title: Before 1 October 2019, will the OSCE verify that separatist forces have withdrawn all of their heavy weaponry in accordance with the Minsk II Peace Agreement?
preds:
This is the first forecast I have done in a long time so I might be a bit rusty…sorry guys. Also, I get that it’s very easy for me to come in late on in this stage and say ‘not happening’, whereas most of you have been forecasting for over a year…so again, sorry about that. I appreciate your forecasts! I have several questions about this and have probably been very lazy with my research. 
Firstly, how is the Minsk II still considered relevant? Annex 1, No,2: “The withdrawal of heavy weapons as specified above is to start on day 2 of the ceasefire at the latest and be completed within 14 days” (http://www.securitycouncilreport.org/atf/cf/%7B65BFCF9B-6D27-4E9C-8CD3-CF6E4FF96FF9%7D/s_res_2202.pdf) . 
Seeing as this ceasefire was supposed to start 0000 on 15 February 2015, I would say that it is not possible to meet the heavy weaponry withdrawal as specified in the Minsk II as it is now 18th September 2019? So, am I missing something here? As @teidi said, Minsk III next.  Secondly, the separatist forces I assume are the armed factions in the Donetsk People’s Republic (DPR) and the Luhansk People’s Republic (LPR). And again, I am assuming that it is the DPR and LPR occupied areas of Donetsk and Luhansk which is classed as non-governmental territory by the OSCE. (If I’m wrong, please correct me). As the most recent quarterly assessment by the OSCE (https://www.osce.org/special-monitoring-mission-to-ukraine/425429?download=true) demonstrated 1269 weapons in violation of withdrawal lines (are these heavy weapons?), 79% of which occurred in non-governmental territory, it doesn’t seem like the separatist forces are going to withdraw their weapons. Especially as this was a 67% increase compared to the first quarter.  Taking into consideration the motivation of the people of the Donetsk and Luhansk regions and their fight for independence, why would they stop fighting now? Especially after the Russian government has taken steps to, let’s say…encourage the DPR and LPR to separate from Ukraine.  Finally, I don’t know how long the verification process would take, but if the OSCE felt confident enough to make a statement verifying this, then they must have already started the verification process (an added caveat being @dcm’s comment on access to sites). Based on the daily updates by the SMM, it doesn’t seem likely before the 1st October.  I will work on answering my own questions, but if anyone has any input that would be great.

The respective parties are still getting ready for the  next round of meetings in the Normandy format;  therefore, meeting the conditions ”yes”  are all the impossible at this point. https://www.ukrinform.net/rubric-polytics/2781090-zelensky-names-three-major-issues-for-normandy-format-summit.html
No, it won't happen within the timeframe of the question. The prisoner swap is a nice gesture, but does not constitute any real progress forward.
Late to this one - but OSCE is hampered in many ways by separatist forces. The idea that 1) weapons are withdrawn and 2) that OSCE can verify is slim. There'd be Minsk III before this happens.
Prisoner swap is positive step, but this is not going to happen by the deadline.
Just realized there is no time for that to happen.

For the first time I have moved from zero %. If trends continue on this current positive trajectory higher numbers will be hit! Russia and Ukraine exchange prisoners in move to improve ties After lengthy negotiations, prisoners arrive in Kiev and Moscow in a step that could ease tensions between two sides.
https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/09/russia-ukraine-prisoner-exchange-190907091503618.html

I am decreasing the probability in my prediction because of Ukrainian President Zelenskiy's hostility towards Putin and his reluctance to comply with parts of the agreement because of Russia's status as a strategic enemy of Ukraine.
I don’t think Russia will back off.

No change.  The Mission saw weapons in violations of withdrawal lines on both sides of the contact line in Luhansk region. https://reliefweb.int/report/ukraine/latest-osce-special-monitoring-mission-ukraine-smm-based-information-received-791
Russia will keep up pressure on Ukraine through the transition of leadership - presidential, and Rada elections.

OSCE self-imposed restrictions to patrol on unpaved roads, which in fact lead to heavy weapon holding areas and permanent storage sites. This restriction is imposed after the incident in 2017, when an SMM vehicle hit an anti-tank mine.
Lmao rotfl atah (ain’t that a hoot)
Minsk so called Peace Agreement has never intended to make peace. Belarus collective farmer dictator Lukashenko is playing in KGB Dictator's Putin's hockey team for more than 20 years...

There is very little incentive for Russia to withdraw weaponry and comply. Russia's interests are in keeping pressure on Ukraine, especially with a new President coming in and upcoming parliamentary elections.  Russia would, in its view, only appear weak if it actually complied or caused/encouraged the separatists to comply.

Ultimately, I believe it's very unlikely separatist forces will pull back all heavy weaponry by the mentioned deadline. Given the already extended deadline from the length of the conflict, plus an uptick in Agreement violations over the past six months, I doubt the previously mentioned arms will be removed. I'm saying 10% just to be a bit optimistic: we still have five more months!

As it stands right now, Eastern Ukrainian separatists serve as a very important bargaining chip for Russia in its proxy conflict with Ukraine. In order to legitimize the separatist factions to as great an extent as possible, it's necessary for Russia to keep them equipped and at a parity with regional Ukrainian security forces. Neither side has a definitive upper hand in the conflict, and while skirmishes are still occurring (in violation of the supposed ceasefire) neither side has an incentive to deescalate their forces and thus present a potential weakness to the enemy.  https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/1060586X.2018.1425083
We are in the 5th year of the conflict.  Verification will not happen by october.
Not really in Putin’s interests to reduce tension too much
Conditions in occupied regions make absolute certainty impossible
Russia will only do this if it gets concessions.
Russia still insist it had nothing to do with the shooting down of MH 17 IN 2014 you can never take any agreement with Russia seriously
Why would they do it? I mean it’s no reason whatsoever so far.

Forecast: Assess a 4% probability that OSCE will verify that all heavy weapons are withdrawn per Minsk II. The bar set by Minsk II is extremely high with the requirement to remove all heavy machine guns, artillery, and missile systems. The monitoring organization OSCE has not had one day in the last year without some type of violation. The small chance of meeting this high bar hinges on a watershed influence by Russia where they influence a full separatist forces pull out, to include all heavy weapons.
Definitions – 
1. Minsk II Peace Agreement - “Withdrawal of all heavy weapons by both sides by equal distances in order to create a security zone of at least 50 km wide from each other” and “Withdrawal of all foreign armed formations, military equipment, as well as mercenaries from the territory of Ukraine under monitoring of the OSCE.”
2. OSCE and Special Monitoring Mission to Ukraine (SMM) – established to monitor and report status of all UNSCR and agreements within OSCE scope. 
Key Facts:  
1. Between 25 February and 10 March, the SMM recorded almost 15,700 ceasefire violations (compared with over 23,000 in the previous two-week period). The Mission also observed 90 weapons in violation of the agreed withdrawal lines (62 in areas not con-trolled by the Government). reports shown below in the key facts. They are the verifier in this case, and they don’t register one day without a violation of Minsk II. Sources:
UN Security Council Resolution 2202 (2015) http://www.securitycouncilreport.org/atf/cf/%7B65BFCF9B-6D27-4E9C-8CD3-CF6E4FF96FF9%7D/s_res_2202.pdf
OSCE Report
https://www.osce.org/special-monitoring-mission-to-ukraine/414275?download=true
have withdrawn ALL... the chances are very very slim!

There are no incentives for the Russians to withdraw support to the separatists faces in the Donbass. Recent US / EU / NATO actions after incidents in the Kerch Strait will reinforce this... https://www.usnews.com/news/politics/articles/2019-03-05/us-considering-new-lethal-aid-to-ukraine-to-deter-russia-top-commander-says
https://www.washingtonpost.com
any country that has been born of mother russia is destined to operate in secrecy.  there are too many ways to deceive monitoring of heavy weapons.

No. Until Russia gives up in Ukraine and accepts western domination (that ukraine is a part of the eu) then the eu will continue to play dirty. Claiming that the "seperatists" have heavy weapons is a western tactic that signals to all westerners that they must be hostile towards Russia and anyone that is on Russia's side (like Maria Butina) or they will be punished for being traitors (like Butina's boyfriend). Signing agreements and violating the terms is a standard western tactic to dominate others. They were probably hoping to get an upper hand by having all the weapons sent back, but then they likely told the Russians that they won't give the verification until all weapons (including non heavy weapons) are withdrawn, along with some other terms that weren't actually on the agreement.
Russia won’t retrace any steps in Ukraine.

Russia is perpetually insecure due to its open land borders stretching across vast steppe. It has little natural boundaries (save for Georgian mountains). Thus, Russia's defense relies on creating varying levels of insecurity through hard and soft power among its neighbors. More-so, if Russia loses Ukraine, Russia loses the birthplace of Russian identity or "Rooski Mir" (Russian World). This is unacceptable to Russia.

No withdrawal of any kind is intended by the "separatist" forces. Even when the supporting country (Russia) would claim this to be the case, the OSCE will very unlikely be able to verify this. Withdrawal of heavy weaponry does not mean that suddenly the inspectors are welcome.
It won't happen before the next Presidential Election on March 31. Russia will pressure Ukraine until that time.

Russia has not withdrawn from Transnistria (Moldova), not withdrawn from South Ossetia (Georgia), built a bridge over the Kerch strait to Crimea (occupied and illegally annexed Ukraine), and it has the same actors now in Ukraine (Vladimir Antyufeyev) as in Moldova (assumed name Shestov, staged incident to institute martial law in the Trans-Dniester) and as shot freedom demonstrators in the denouement of the Soviet Union. It's inconceivable to anticipate Russia (aka "separatists") will ever withdraw forces,  materiel, or armaments unless compelled to do so by force. (Which NATO proved will never occur on its watch, given it backed down in Pristina.)

Withdrawal  of  all  heavy  weapons  by  both  sides  by  equal  distances  in  order  to create  a  security  zone  of  at  least  50  km  wide  from  each  other  for  the  artillery systems  of calibre of  100  and  more,  a  security  zone  of  70  km  wide  for  MLRS  and 
140 km wide for MLRS “Tornado - S”, Uragan, Smerch and Tactical Missile Systems (Tochka, Tochka U) While the OSCE status report of 24 Dec 2018 states that between 10 and 23 Dec, there were 221 weapons violations, the report did not specify if they are the "heavy weapons" described in the Minsk Agreement.  However, without some specificity, it is reasonable to assume that lack of compliance (13600 ceasefire violations) is an indicator of probable lack of compliance in the heavy weaponry withdrawal.
Seriously? It is Russia. Once they take over a country, they are their to stay.
The Russia’s will never let this happen
According to Czar Vlad the Shirtless they have already been withdrawn and Ukrainians are fighting each other over who can be best friends with Mother Russia!
There is a chance of successful deception.
unlikely to occur due to continuing tensions with West.
They will try but fail. It will be a qualified report at best.
Given the Sea of Azov  opening of a new front in hybrid warfare against Ukraine, chances of implementing Minsk II are nil.
As reported on 27 December 2018 by Ukrainian news agency UNIAN, not a single provision of the Minsk deal has been 100% implemented.
As reported on 27 December 2018 by Ukrainian news agency UNIAN, not a single provision of the Minsk deal has been 100% implemented.

OSCE reported about violations yesterday: https://www.osce.org/special-monitoring-mission-to-ukraine/407840
I don't see any new initiatives to get this situation moving again, so predicting no change with high probability.
Doubtful due to the small number of tools in the hands of OSCE itself. In addition, the Russians keep heavy equipment close to the border in order to deter the Ukrainian government from escalating.
Very low chance all weaponry like that will be removed...there is no valuable incentive for the separatists to comply.
Required access to make the verification will be a problem.
Why would Putin do that?  No country with any power is putting any serious pressure on him.  He's got his frozen conflict.

An end to the war in eastern Ukraine looks as far away as ever Even peace talks have ground to a halt
https://www.economist.com/europe/2018/10/13/an-end-to-the-war-in-eastern-ukraine-looks-as-far-away-as-ever Russia’s continued failure to fulfill its Minsk commitments. We call on Russia to join Ukraine in pursuing peace. Russia and the forces it arms, trains, leads, and fights alongside have yet to follow through on repeated commitments to cease hostilities, withdraw foreign fighters, exchange detainees, or disband the illegal armed formations. Moscow should institute a full and comprehensive ceasefire and cancel the illegal sham elections it is organizing in the Russia-controlled parts of eastern Ukraine. 
https://www.state.gov/r/pa/prs/ps/2018/10/286573.htm The SMM recorded fewer ceasefire violations in Donetsk region and more in Luhansk region, compared with the previous reporting period. It observed a fresh crater caused by shelling in a residential area of Sakhanka. The Mission continued monitoring the disengagement areas near Stanytsia Luhanska, Zolote and Petrivske, and observed ceasefire violations near the Petrivske and Zolote disengagement areas. An SMM patrol heard and saw an explosion near Pervomaisk, approximately 300m west of its location. The SMM’s access remained restricted in all three disengagement areas as well as near Siedove, Novoazovsk and Voznesenivka, near the border with the Russian Federation.* The SMM observed weapons in violation of the agreed withdrawal lines near Pidlisne. An SMM long-range unmanned aerial vehicle again spotted vehicles, including a truck carrying an armoured personnel carrier, entering and exiting Ukraine via an unpaved road in a non-government-controlled area of Donetsk region near the border with the Russian Federation where there are no border crossing facilities. 
https://www.osce.org/special-monitoring-mission-to-ukraine/399674

There is little to no possibility of such drastic changes happening. This is because the Kremlin is interested in keeping a frozen conflict in Ukraine and therefore will be a major player. However, Zaharchenko's death showed that not all separatists are Putin's puppets. It is clear that some of them regard Putin as a savior but some also view him with contempt because he failed to secure many social guarantees that he promised to Donbass. Therefore, analyzing Kremlin's intentions for the region is not enough to make this forecast. However, it is important to also not overestimate the agency of the separatists. There is also a small possibility of some backdoor deal with Ukraine on the part of separatists too that seems too far-fetched as well.  The Kremlin's ability to adequately support the separatists depends upon Russia's domestic economy which is in free fall. Consequently, unless the Kremlin fails to capitalize upon the most minimum of support to the independent regions, the separatists will stay the current course of action.

I do not believe that the OSCE will make this declaration. The Kremlin wants to maintain a protracted conflict, and the OSCE wants to keep the SMM alive and funded. Barring any major developments I do not foresee many changes on the ground.
Assassination of Zakharchenko has made the separatist more hawkish.
Putin is not withdrawing his forces in Ukraine. There is no pressure from #45 to force his arm because #45 always be singing "You got a friend in me. You got a friend in me."

No way frozen conflicts in Abkhazia, Ossetia and Crimea and Donetsk and Luhansk
unfreeze until Czar Vlad passes from scene

Since my last update roughly 5 weeks ago the consensus moved from 0% to 5%. Skimming the Wikipedia article on Minsk II [1] doesn't reveal any sign of positive developments, though. Maybe the Trump-Putin summit can be interpreted as a positive sign? I would have expected that this summit rather says "Putin can do what he wants.", which would lower the probability of this prediction. Therefore, I will slightly update from my current 10% to let's say 7%. [1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minsk_II
going with @dcm with a slight chance two men agreed something undocumented in a one on one.

Typical response from Russia (as should now be abundantly clear to the world) https://www.unian.info/war/10191291-russia-ignoring-proposals-to-allow-osce-access-to-25-km-zone-closed-to-observation-at-border-with-ukraine-general-staff.html
17 July 2018
Russia is ignoring proposals to allow access of inspection teams of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe to a 25-kilometer zone along the border with Ukraine on the territory of Rostov region, which is closed by Russia for observation, according to the head of the Verification Department of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, Andriy Hudz. "Of concern of the OSCE states is the presence of a significant number of Russian military units in Rostov region, especially in the 25-kilometer zone along the Ukrainian border, and their sudden build-up during the exercises. Russia ignores the proposals of Ukraine and other leading OSCE states to allow access of the OSCE inspection teams to this zone along the border with Ukraine on the territory of Rostov region, which is now closed by Russia, even for aerial observation," Andriy Hudz told a briefing on Tuesday, an UNIAN correspondent reports. According to the military official, Russia systematically resorts to unpredictable military activities and actively uses gaps in the Vienna Document of 2011. Read also OSCE reports 325 explosions within 24 hours amid "harvest ceasefire" in Donbas "Russia uses sudden (undeclared) military exercises and exercises below thresholds as an instrument of foreign policy to demonstrate military force with a view to significantly affecting security and stability in the OSCE area. It resorts to camouflaging the activities of troops (forces) and their fragmentation, thus hiding the actual number of personnel and weapons involved, including the number of aircraft and helicopter flights," Hudz explained. http://tass.com/world/1012136
5 July 2018
Russia urges Western powers to make Kiev comply with its obligations the Package of Measures for the Implementation of the Minsk Agreements, Russia’s envoy to the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) said on Thursday.  "We call on Western countries to exert influence on Kiev, so that it would strictly observe its obligations under the Minsk Complex of Measures," Alexander Lukashevich told the OSCE Permanent Council. The Russian diplomat added that "references to the non-existent ‘Russian aggression’ or to the increasingly complicated political situation in Ukraine will put [the solution of] problems on hold for an indefinite period."  "No one in Russia is interested in that," he said.   Lukashevich alsoo said that Russia opposes Kiev’s policy of suppressing dissent in Eastern Ukraine and will keep supporting the local population with food and daily necessities.  "We oppose Kiev’s policy to suppress dissenters in Eastern Ukraine. We will keep supporting the population of Donbass with food and daily necessities," Alexander Lukashevich told the OSCE Permanent Council.  The Russian diplomat said that another humanitarian aid convoy entered the region on June 28 via the Donetsk and Matveyev Kurgan border crossings. https://reliefweb.int/report/ukraine/latest-osce-special-monitoring-mission-ukraine-smm-based-information-received-486 (UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA))
17 July 2018 In Donetsk region, the SMM recorded more ceasefire violations[1], including about 70 explosions, compared with the previous reporting period (about 20 explosions).

During the day of 16 July, positioned on Tsentralna Street, in a residential area of Dokuchaievsk (non-government-controlled, 30km south-west of Donetsk), the SMM heard five explosions, assessed as outgoing mortar rounds, and 40 bursts of small-arms and heavy-machine-gun fire about 100m west. Thereafter, the SMM saw that about ten people, whom the SMM had previously seen walking along the same street, had begun running to seek shelter in nearby buildings. Later during the day, positioned about 4km east of Dokuchaievsk, the SMM heard and saw uncountable undetermined explosions 3-7km south-west and west, as well as two columns of white and black smoke, respectively, emanating from areas in and near Dokuchaievsk. Positioned about 3km south-east of Dokuchaievsk, the SMM heard 17 undetermined explosions 5-7km south-west and west. At the same location, the SMM heard and saw an airburst and an undetermined explosion 3-7km south-south-west and it heard three bursts of heavy-machine-gun fire 5km west. On the evening and night of 15-16 July, the SMM camera at the Donetsk Filtration Station (DFS) (15km north of Donetsk) recorded, in sequence, a projectile and a flare in flight from west to east and six projectiles from north-north-west to south-south-east, followed by a total of 35 projectiles (12 in vertical flight, eight from east to west, 11 from north-west to south-east and four from north-north-west to south-south-east) and one undetermined explosion, all 0.7-5km south. On the evening and night of 15-16 July, the SMM camera at the entry-exit checkpoint in Marinka (government-controlled, 23km south-west of Donetsk) recorded, in sequence, six illumination flares in vertical flight and a projectile in flight from west to east, followed by a total of ten undetermined explosions, 61 projectiles (seven from north to south, 17 from east to west, one from south to north, two from west-north-west to east-north-east and 34 from west to east), five illumination flares in vertical flight, a muzzle flash and a burst, all 2-5km north. On the evening and night of 15-16 July, the SMM camera at the entry-exit checkpoint in Pyshchevyk (government-controlled, 25km north-east of Mariupol) recorded, in sequence, 18 projectiles in flight from east to west, two projectiles from west to east and 11 projectiles from east to west, all 4-9km south. During the day on 16 July, positioned about 1km north-west of the railway station in Yasynuvata (non-government-controlled, 16km north-east of Donetsk), the SMM heard and saw three undetermined explosions 2-4km south-west and west-south-west, and heard four undetermined explosions 2-4km south-west and north-north-west, as well as 23 bursts and shots of small-arms and heavy-machine-gun fire, all 1-3km south-west and west-south-west. During the day on 16 July, positioned on the south-eastern outskirts of Avdiivka (government-controlled, 17km north of Donetsk), the SMM heard 22 undetermined explosions and 24 shots of small-arms fire, all 1-4km at directions ranging from north-east to south. In Luhansk region, the SMM recorded more ceasefire violations, including a similar number of explosions, compared with the previous reporting period (two explosions). The SMM continued to monitor the disengagement process and to pursue full access to the disengagement areas near Stanytsia Luhanska (16km north-east of Luhansk), Zolote (60km west of Luhansk) and Petrivske (41km south of Donetsk)[2], as foreseen in the Framework Decision of the Trilateral Contact Group relating to disengagement of forces and hardware of 21 September 2016. The SMM’s access remained restricted, but the Mission was able to partially monitor them.* On the evening and night of 15-16 July, the SMM camera in Zolote recorded, in sequence, eight bursts and two undetermined explosions all 3.5-7km south-east, south-south-east and south (all assessed as outside the disengagement area). During the day on 16 July, positioned in and near the Stanytsia Luhanska disengagement area, the SMM observed a calm situation. The SMM continued to monitor the withdrawal of weapons in implementation of the Memorandum and the Package of Measures and its Addendum. In violation of withdrawal lines, in government-controlled areas, on 14 July, an SMM long-range unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) spotted two self-propelled howitzers (2S3 Akatsiya, 152mm) near Keramik (28km north-west of Donetsk). On 15 July, an SMM mini-UAV spotted two self-propelled howitzers (2S1 Gvozdika, 122mm) near Putylyne (44km north-west of Luhansk). In non-government-controlled areas, on 14 July, an SMM long-range UAV spotted three tanks (one T-64 and two possible T-64) in a residential area of Verkhnoshyrokivske (85km south of Donetsk) and 12 tanks (type undetermined) about 2km north of Svobodne (73km south of Donetsk). Beyond withdrawal lines but outside designated storage sites in a non-government-controlled area, on 14 July, an SMM long-range UAV spotted four tanks (possible T-72) west of Markyne (94km south of Donetsk). The SMM observed armoured combat vehicles[3] and other indications of military-type presence in the security zone. In government-controlled areas, on 14 July, an SMM long-range UAV spotted four infantry fighting vehicles (IFV) (one BMP-2 and three BMP variants) near Novohryhorivka (55km south of Donetsk), an IFV (BMP-2) near Bohdanivka (41km south-west of Donetsk), an IFV (BMP-2) and an armoured personnel carrier (APC) (MT-LB) in Taramchuk (29km south-west of Donetsk), two IFVs (BMP variants) near Slavne (26km south-west of Donetsk), an APC (BTR variant) in Krasnohorivka (21km west of Donetsk). On 14 July, an SMM mid-range UAV spotted four IFVs (two BMP-1 and two BMP-2) near Nelipivka (40km north-east of Donetsk). On the same day, an SMM mini-UAV spotted an IFV (BMP-2) near Hranitne (60km south of Donetsk). On 16 July, the SMM saw an APC (BTR variant) near Zolote-2/Karbonit (62km west of Luhansk), an IFV (BMP variant) and a newly dug trench in Zolote-4/Rodina (59km west of Luhansk), an APC (MB-LB) in Trokhizbenka (32km north-west of Luhansk), as well as seven APCs (BTR-80) near Popasna (69km west of Luhansk). In non-government-controlled areas, on 14 July, an SMM long-range UAV spotted three APCs (two BTR-80 and an MT-LB) and four IFVs (BMP-1) in Bezimenne (non-government-controlled, 30km east of Mariupol), six IFVs (BMP-2) in Khreshchatytske (86km south of Donetsk), a probable TORN radio intelligence system in a residential area of Maiorove (formerly Krasnyi Oktiabr, 57km south-east of Donetsk) (see SMM Daily Report of 9 June 2018) and an APC (BTR-80) near Styla (34km south of Donetsk). The SMM observed the presence of mines and mine hazard signs. An SMM mid-range UAV again spotted at least 300 anti-tank mines laid in two rows near Nelipivka (see SMM Daily Report of 29 June 2018). On the side of a road leading from Solodke (government-controlled, 33km south-west of Donetsk) to Olhynka (government-controlled, 40km south-west of Donetsk), the SMM saw for the first time a rectangular mine hazard sign (with “No entry, demining activities” written in Ukrainian). ...

Myfuamerica's comment (http://www.gjopen.com/comments/comments/724699
) made me increase my doubt in the efficacy of international agreements and this plus the still remaining 0% consensus makes me update from 30% to 20%.
no evidence of goodwill or moves towards a peaceable plan
No a chance that early, more pounding will take place.
This just in from Tsar Vlad the Shirtless: bwaaaaaaahahaha
Made an update but forgot to change the number from 42% to 30%.
Since my last forecast the consensus is still 0%, which I will take as more evidence that it is way more unlikely than my first estimation. Going from 42% to 30%.
That is not on the Putin agenda.

Why would any Russian leader cede Eastern Ukraine in light of previous U.S. plans (now scrapped) to place interceptor missiles on the ground in Poland and an advanced radar system in the Czech Republic to obstensibly fend long-range missiles from Iran?  Ukraine was Included in the list of countries where the radar would possibly be placed in the framework of America’s new anti-missile defense plan. Ukraine repordedly was interested in that opportunity.
Seems more likely this ends up being like other frozen conflicts in the region (see Georgia and Moldova) and nothing really changes during the time frame.

Intuition base rate: 90% chance that a party follows international treaties in a crisis situation. 
This seems to fit with a paper from the CIIA in 2006 ("the vast majority of treaties―and hundreds of new ones are negotiated each year―do actually work") [1]. According to the paper, it helps if verification is strong (which seems to be the case with Minsk II), sanctions are in place to deter defection (haven't seen something like that on the German Wiki page about Minsk II) and one deals with cooperative countries (separatists and Russia sound a bit defective to me). I'll update slightly downwards to 85%. Now, looking at fellow forecasters, people seem much more sceptical, one comment casting doubt on the verification process. Hmm, I guess I'll have to make a heavy update. I'll just go to meet in the middle between current 0% chance and my 85%, so 42%. Sounds like a reasonable number. The SMM observed weapons that could not be verified as withdrawn, as their storage did not comply with the criteria set out in the 16 October 2015 notification from the SMM to the signatories of the Package of Measures on effective monitoring and verification of the withdrawal of heavy weapons. In government-controlled areas of Donetsk region, the SMM noted that 20 self-propelled howitzers (18 2S1 and two 2S3 Akatsiya, 152mm) were still missing. The SMM observed armoured combat vehicles[2], anti-aircraft weapons, and trenches in the security zone. In government-controlled areas, the SMM saw an armoured personnel carrier (APC) (BTR-70) south-east of Lebedynske (16km north-east of Mariupol) and three infantry fighting vehicles (IFV) (BMP variant) near Novotroitske (36km south-west of Donetsk). On 7 April, an SMM mid-range UAV spotted an IFV near Orikhove (57km north-west of Luhansk), five IFVs (one BMP-variant and four BMP-2) near Hranitne (60km south of Donetsk), two IFVs (BMP-1) in Novoselivka Druha (69km south of Donetsk) and an IFV (BMP-1) in Novoselivka (66km south of Donetsk), as well as two APCs (BTR-80) in Stanytsia Luhanska (outside the disengagement area).

The OSCE is one of many international organizations which have lost credibility, since until now it has shown a blind eye on the atrocities the Ukrainian fascistic junta is doing in so called separatists areas. There live Ukrainians, who have not accepted the ousting of the legally elected president, which was possible only with the help of USA.  The main contributing factor to the loss of trust to those international organizations is the  behavior of the USA - its is obeying to decisions of the international organizations only, if it fits it's national interests. If i.e. the UN does what the US wants - that's good, if not, USA doesn't care and does any way what it wants.  
This behavior shatters the international system of institutions, which was designed after uncounted wars to solve the various conflicts on the base of law and negotiations - a system, which grants protection for small countries, a system which was designed to prevent big and strong countries to solve their problems at the cost of weaker nations.
The second problem is, that US has taken control of international institutions, which were set up to function as independent specialized international bodies, who will be trusted from all nations, independently of their conflicts among each other. There are many examples - like the OPCW, Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons, and other, like the anti doping organization.
In a highly politicized conflict against Russia the USA lead "West" countries have manipulated the results of the above mentioned bodies and have done a tremendous damage to the very foundation of the modern globalized world.
This has triggered an earthquake for the international relations, which will settle only then, when new rules of engagement will be established. Those are either the reestablishment of the trust in the integrity of those international institutions, or the rule of the stronger. Needless to say, which would be the better one - therefore the question: Is the current US administration destroying the existing international system only, to gain some short sighted advantage in a tactical battle? Obviously, the development of the multi polar world is unavoidable. It can be merely postponed for some time for the price of destructing the above mentioned system and increasing tensions among nuclear powers - is this a wise political behavior? I am doubting it.
